security: Disclosing the existence and purpose of the Community Central Index, including the key words used for identifying materials, could reveal intelligence collection priorities and methods. Quoting directly: '...a list of 40 key words to be used in identifying material furnished the Index.' and 'Forms for inputting information to the Central Index were also provided to the Group. This is a service of common concern which will assure the uniformity of information received and should serve to lighten the workload of the individual agencies.' This information could be exploited by adversaries to evade detection or manipulate intelligence analysis.
summary: Minutes from a USIB Ad Hoc Coordinating Group meeting on Congressional Review, discussing responses to Senate Select Committee inquiries, including CIA's coordination, key areas of interest (assassinations, Phoenix program, covert action), and the implementation of a Community Central Index.
summary_one_paragraph: This document summarizes the proceedings of a USIB Ad Hoc Coordinating Group meeting on June 4, 1975, focusing on the U.S. intelligence community's response to Congressional inquiries, particularly those from the Senate Select Committee. Key discussion points included CIA's role in preparing comprehensive papers on specific subjects, especially assassinations, the Phoenix program, and covert actions, and the need to coordinate information sharing with the Post Office Department. The meeting addressed the establishment of reading rooms for SSC staff, the provision of materials, and the implementation of a Community Central Index to ensure uniformity of information across agencies.
title: USIB Ad Hoc Coordinating Group on Congressional Review
